how_to_grow_garlic_title: How to grow garlic in pots
growing_garlic_in_pots_description: Growing garlic in pots is an excellent option for small spaces, especially for those who don't have access to a garden. By using containers, you can easily control the growing environment, ensuring your garlic plants receive the necessary care and attention.
choose_garlic_variety_and_pot_descriptio: Choose a garlic variety that is well-suited for your region's climate, and pick a pot that is deep enough to allow the garlic cloves to grow properly. Make sure the pot has drainage holes to prevent water from accumulating at the bottom, which could lead to root rot.
prepare_substrate_description: Use a high-quality, nutrient-rich soil that is well-aerated to plant the garlic cloves. The soil should have a slightly acidic pH and be loose enough to allow the roots to spread and grow freely.
plant_the_garlic_cloves: Plant the garlic cloves with the pointed end facing up, making sure to space them about 4 inches apart. Lightly cover the cloves with soil and water gently to help them settle into place.
place_pot_in_sunny_location: Place the pot in a sunny location where it will receive at least 6 hours of direct sunlight every day. Garlic plants require plenty of light to grow strong and healthy, so make sure the location is well-lit.
moderate_watering_and_care: Water the garlic plants moderately, ensuring the soil stays moist but not soggy. Be careful not to overwater, as this can lead to root rot. Remove any weeds that appear to prevent them from competing with your garlic for nutrients.
garlic_harvest_timing_and_process: Garlic is ready to harvest when the leaves start turning yellow and dry out. Carefully dig up the bulbs, taking care not to damage them, and let them cure in a dry, cool place for a few weeks before storing them.

conservation_text: Implement water conservation practices such as rainwater harvesting. Recycle used water whenever possible.
organic_farming_text: Reduce the use of pesticides and synthetic fertilizers. Promote biodiversity by planting hedgerows and maintaining natural habitat areas.
waste_management_text: Compost organic waste to create natural fertilizer. Recycle and reuse materials whenever possible.
lock_icon: Locked padlock icon, indicating that the actuator name is read-only
sensor_name_locked_description: This field is locked and only displays the sensor name.
sensor_code_invalid: The sensor code is not valid.
color_description: The selected color will be the background of the plot.
selection_text: Choose crop varieties that are resistant to common diseases in your area. Consider crops that adapt well to your region's climate and soil.
irrigation_text: Implement efficient irrigation systems, such as drip irrigation, to conserve water. Water early in the morning or late in the evening to minimize evaporation.
pest_control_text: Use integrated pest management (IPM) techniques to reduce the use of chemical pesticides. Introduce beneficial insects that prey on common pests.
renewable_energy_description: Consider installing solar panels or wind turbines to reduce dependence on non-renewable energy sources. Use biogas produced from agricultural waste as an energy source.
energy_optimization_description: Implement energy efficiency practices, such as using LED bulbs and efficient equipment. Monitor and manage energy consumption to identify areas for improvement and reduce costs.
confirm_delete_rule: Are you sure you want to delete this rule?

alert_humidity_below_20: Alert icon, indicating that humidity is below 20%
humidity_below_20: Humidity is below 20%. Irrigation is recommended ðŸ’§
soil_tests_description: Conduct soil tests regularly to know the pH and nutrient levels. Adjust soil pH according to the needs of your crops.
crop_rotation_description: Implement crop rotation to prevent nutrient depletion and reduce pests and diseases. Alternate deep-root crops with shallow-root crops.
fertilization_description: Use organic fertilizers whenever possible. Apply fertilizers based on the results of the soil tests.
